subject: Re: [junit] How to test threaded method?
msgSnippet: ... I have to admit that my multithreading skills are atrocious. This is the first time I ever understood multithreaded programming in Java. Thank you. -- J.
messageBody:
Timothy Wall wrote:

> Do a wait on a shared object; when all events have been fired, do a
> notify. On the original wait, set your max timeout, e.g.
>
> final Object lock = new Object();
> synchronized(lock) {
> lock.wait(TIMEOUT_INTERVAL);
> }
> assertEquals(eventsExpected, eventsReceived);
>
> On your event-listening thread:
>
> synchronized(lock) {
> // after all events have been sent
> lock.notifyAll();
> }

I have to admit that my multithreading skills are atrocious. This is the
first time I ever understood multithreaded programming in Java. Thank you.
--
